ON HIS RETURN to Moscow from the army, Nicholas Rost6v was welcomed by his home cir- cle as the best of sons, a hero, and their darling Nik61enka; by his relations as a charming, at- tractive, and polite youngman; by his acquaint- ances as a handsome lieutenant of hussars, a good dancer, and one of the best matches in the city.
